title: Communications Manager
description:
**Job Overview**  
The Norwalk Community College Foundation, Inc. (NCCF) is a 501(c) (3) corporation that supports and raises funds for the benefit of CT State Community College- Norwalk (CT State Norwalk), its students, faculty, and programs, to further the educational purposes of CT State Norwalk.

**The Communications Manager position is an exciting leadership opportunity to raise the visibility of the important work of NCCF and CT State Norwalk**. This full-time, exempt position reports to the CEO of NCCF and requires a creative, entrepreneurial, detail-oriented, and technology-savvy professional, who is dedicated to the mission of NCCF. The Communications Manager works with the CEO and consultants to develop a compelling and consistent brand identity and marketing and communications plan and executes on both, including the creation and distribution of press releases, print and digital materials, video, social media and web content. The Communications Manager also partners with the Board and other members of the development and communications team to plan and execute special events.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Manage the relationship with external consultants and execute on plans, strategies, and brand identity developed in partnership with consultants.

· Create and manage an annual communications project calendar incorporating all marketing, communications, and development activities.

· Design engaging content and events that enhance NCCF’s visibility with consistent branding and messaging.

· Lead the creation and production of the annual report, annual appeal and scholarship, program, and impact reports.

· Design and create the program, invitation, remarks, collateral materials, and event promotion for the Annual Meeting, Annual Scholarship event, and other NCCF-sponsored events.

· Produce monthly newsletters, including design and content.

· Develop and execute a results-driven social media campaign.

· Manage the website, including developing and updating content and executing a drive-to-web strategy.

· Create and maintain connections and communication with internal and external stakeholders to ensure access to timely and accurate information.

· Creatively partner with students and faculty in communications-related areas to provide opportunities to students to be content-creators/advisors.

**Knowledge – Skills & Abilities**

· Commitment to the mission and dedication to partnership with the College and its faculty, staff, and students.

· Minimum of 5 years of experience in a nonprofit communications role.

· Exceptional writing, editing and oral communication skills as well as proficiency in engaging with a wide range of external and internal constituencies to identify and share content.

· Ability to think strategically, analytically, and creatively, and to reorient strategy in response to new opportunities and changing priorities.

· Ability to deliver a high volume of high-quality work within designated timelines.

· Self-starter that meets deadlines and has excellent organization, attention to detail and teamwork skills.

· Ability to build strong relationships, work independently, make decisions, maintain confidentiality, multitask, organize, and prioritize while maintaining high standards.

· Experience with graphic design tools (Canva, photoshop, etc.), video editing, social media marketing tools (Hootsuite, etc.) website management (WordPress), email marketing (Blackbaud), and the ability to track and report on communications analytics across multiple platforms. Willingness to learn new software applications, as needed.

· Excellent computer skills, including in-depth knowledge of all Microsoft Office, G-Suite, Zoom, etc.

· Required: A successful candidate will have multiple writing samples and a project portfolio.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Canva: 3 years (Required)
* Writing skills: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft Office: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Norwalk, CT 06854 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Norwalk, CT 06854: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Residential Assistant Manager (Group Home) - All Five Boroughs
description:
**Company Description**  

AHRC NYC is one of the largest providers of services for children and adults with developmental disabilities in New York City**.** Our mission is to advocate for people who are neuro-diverse to lead full and equitable lives. Come join the company where generosity guides us as we honor our legacy and continuously grow through a culture of curiosity, creativity and optimism.

 **Job Description** **AHRC NYC is currently seeking Residential Assistant Managers (RAM) for their residences in ALL FIVE BOROUGHS. The RAM is responsible for collaborating with the Residence Manager and other management team members in overseeing all aspects of operation for the community residential program to which he/she is assigned.**

**The RAM position has an annual salary of $43k depending on residence plus overtime and a very generous benefit package that includes FULL MEDICAL AT NO COST TO YOU! dental and vision plans, tuition reimbursement, a 403b retirement plan with employer match, generous paid time off and more.**

**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBITIES**


§ Assists with ensuring ongoing compliance and quality assurance with State and Federal regulations applicable to operation of facility to which he/she is assigned.


§ Provides direct supervision and guidance to direct support employees assigned to residence. Confers with Residence Manager in completing mandated written evaluations of staff in residence, as well as participates in overseeing any disciplinary actions needed to address performance problems by staff.


§ Provides service coverage in accordance with staff scheduling established by Residence Manager, as well as provides coverage in cases where scheduling may change due to direct staff shortages or emerging needs of residents.


§ Assumes responsibility for smooth operations of residence, including adherence to funder’s and agency’s policies and procedures related to house and vehicle maintenance, fire safety, and residents’ and personnel files.


§ Collaborates with Residence Manager in planning each resident’s individualized program of services and care, covering both daily and longer-term needs, and ensuring delivery of services and care by direct care staff that addresses each resident’s interests, preferences, strengths and capabilities.


§ When assigned to oversee medical services, collaborates with residence clinical staff to monitor direct care activities related to medical services, including ongoing maintenance of electronic and paper medical records, scheduling and attending of medical appointments, proper administration of medications, and request for referrals as needed.


§ Ensures each resident’s basic needs are met, including adequate supply of food, clothing, personal hygiene items, and any other personal belongings necessary to meet individual’s needs within the home environment.


Along with Residence Manager, serves as liaison with Treatment Coordinator in reviewing quality of active treatment services and expected residential habilitation outcomes, including attending team meetings, evaluating accuracy of activity schedules and documented.


§ In conjunction with Residence Manager, formulates and recommends new ideas and outcomes directed towards enhancing quality of each resident’s life.


§ Attends and successfully completes mandated and skills development training courses, as assigned, as well as provides training to staff at residence, as needed.

 **Qualifications**  

§ High school diploma or HSE, along with 12-18 months of related experience required.


§ Experience supervising staff in a residential setting preferred not required.


$ Experience with individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities REQUIRED.


§ Must be knowledgeable in the field of developmental and intellectual disabilities and have knowledge of OPWDD regulations.


§ Must have ability to assist in planning, organizing, developing, and implementing program policies and procedures in timely and consistent manner.


§ Ability to deal diplomatically with personnel, residents, family members, visitors, government agencies and the general public.


§ A valid New York state Tri-State driver's license for more than one year in good standing with minimal violations **is required for most but not all positions.**

 **Additional Information** **Benefits:**

* **Full Medical Ins. at no cost to employee (Single & Family Plans)**
* Generous Paid time off (sick, personal & vacation)
* Paid Training
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Referral program
* 403(b) retirement plan
* 403(b) company match
* Life insurance
* Employee discount
* Health savings account


AHRC New York City is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider applicants for all positions without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, gender, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, disability, marital status, partnership status, military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking, genetic information, or unemployment or any other protected characteristic under federal, state or local law.

  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Bilingual Office Manager
description:
**Position Overview**:  
Intellectus Preparatory Charter School (IPCS) seeks a dedicated and highly organized **Bilingual Office Manager** to oversee daily operations and various special projects on a continual basis. The Office Manager will support the Executive Director in ensuring the smooth and efficient running of the school, while maintaining key administrative, financial, and operational duties. The ideal candidate will be bilingual (Spanish/English), possess excellent interpersonal skills, and be able to balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced educational environment.

**Key Responsibilities**:**School Enrollment & Recruitment**

* Lead and manage the school’s enrollment process from initial inquiry to admission, ensuring all prospective families have a positive experience.
* Develop and implement recruitment strategies to increase student enrollment in collaboration with the Executive Director.
* Manage student records, including applications, registration, and enrollment data, ensuring accuracy and compliance with state and federal requirements.
* Coordinate and attend recruitment events, open houses, and community outreach programs to promote IPCS and attract prospective families.

**Office Management**

* **Manage office operations**, ensuring efficiency in administrative processes and optimizing workflow.
* **Oversee vendor management**, including negotiating contracts and maintaining strong relationships.
* **Supervise front desk activities**, ensuring excellent phone etiquette and customer service at all times.
* **Coordinate schedule management** for staff meetings, appointments, and school events, ensuring smooth execution.
* **Handle payroll processing**, ensuring accurate and timely payments for all employees.
* **Lead team management initiatives**, fostering a collaborative and positive work environment.
* **Implement office management best practices** to improve overall workflow and productivity within the office.
* **Maintain office supplies inventory**, ordering supplies as necessary to keep operations running smoothly.
* **Assist with onboarding new employees**, providing training on office procedures and protocols.

**Financial & Operational Support**

* Assist in managing the school's budget in collaboration with the Executive Director, tracking expenditures and identifying opportunities for cost-saving measures.
* Process invoices, purchase orders, and vendor payments, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
* Monitor school inventory, including supplies, materials, and technology equipment, ensuring proper ordering and maintenance.
* Assist in preparing financial reports and ensuring compliance with internal controls and audit standards.

**Per-Pupil Billing & Reporting**

* Oversee and manage the per-pupil billing process to ensure accurate and timely submission of invoices for all enrolled students.
* Track and reconcile per-pupil payments from the district, state, or other sources to ensure proper allocation of funds.
* Maintain up-to-date records of student enrollment for billing purposes, ensuring compliance with all funding requirements.
* Collaborate with the Executive Director and finance team to prepare reports related to per-pupil funding and revenue projections.
* Respond to inquiries related to per-pupil billing from external stakeholders, including school districts and funding agencies.

**Human Resources Support**

* Assist with onboarding new employees and maintaining accurate employee records.
* Coordinate staff training and development programs as needed.
* Oversee timekeeping and payroll submission processes.

**School Operations**

* Manage facility operations, ensuring a safe and clean learning environment for all students and staff.
* Coordinate with external vendors for maintenance, repairs, and service contracts.
* Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations related to school operations and safety standards.

**Food Services Management**

* Oversee the daily operation of the school’s food service program, including coordinating meal planning, delivery, and distribution to students.
* Collaborate with food service vendors to ensure meals meet nutritional standards and compliance with local, state, and federal guidelines.
* Monitor inventory of food supplies, order products as needed, and maintain accurate records of food service expenses.
* Handle any food-related concerns or complaints from parents and ensure all food services operate efficiently and safely.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations, including sanitation and food handling standards.

**Qualifications**:

* Bilingual (Spanish/English) required.
* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Education, Finance, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 3-5 years of office management, operations, or enrollment experience, preferably in a school or non-profit setting.
* Experience with per-pupil billing or similar financial operations in education is highly desirable.
* Strong understanding of budget management and financial operations.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with diverse stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and student information systems.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.

**Work Hours & Benefits**:

* Full-time position with competitive salary, based on experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plan, and professional development opportunities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Do you live in or around Mount Vernon, NY 10550?

Experience:

* Bilingual: 1 year (Required)
* Office management: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Food Handler Certification (Required)

title: Dental Operations Manager
description:
At Holistic Dental Center of NJ, we are committed to providing exceptional dental care with a focus on patient comfort and cutting-edge technology. As a leading provider in our community, we pride ourselves on our dedicated team of professionals and our welcoming atmosphere. We are seeking a visionary Dental Operations Manager(DOM) to drive our practice's strategic growth and operational excellence.

**Position Overview:**

The DOM will provide strategic leadership and oversee the overall operations of our dental practice. The ideal candidate will be an experienced leader with a proven track record in healthcare management, particularly within the dental industry. This role requires a dynamic individual who can drive innovation, manage a diverse team, and enhance patient satisfaction while achieving business objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategic Leadership:** Develop and implement strategic plans to achieve the practice's vision, goals, and growth objectives.
* **Operational Oversight:** Manage day-to-day operations, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness in all areas of the practice.
* **Financial Management:** Oversee budgeting, financial planning, and resource allocation to ensure the practice's financial health.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead, mentor, and motivate a diverse team of dental professionals and administrative staff to achieve high performance and job satisfaction.
* **Patient Care Excellence:** Uphold the highest standards of patient care and service, ensuring a positive and compassionate experience for all patients.
* **Business Development:** Identify and pursue opportunities for growth, including new services, partnerships, and market expansion.
* **Compliance and Quality:** Ensure adherence to all regulatory requirements and industry standards, maintaining a safe and compliant work environment.
* **Community Engagement:** Represent the practice in the community, building relationships and enhancing the practice's reputation.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Management, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 5-7 years of executive management experience in a dental setting, with a strong understanding of dental practice operations.
* **Leadership Skills:** Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* **Financial Acumen:** Proficiency in financial management, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
* **Strategic Thinking:** Ability to develop and execute strategic plans that drive practice growth and improve operational efficiency.
* **Patient Focus:** Strong commitment to delivering exceptional patient care and enhancing the patient experience.
* **Regulatory Knowledge:** Familiarity with healthcare regulations, compliance standards, and best practices in the dental industry.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Competitive Salary:** Attractive compensation package commensurate with experience.
* **Benefits:** Comprehensive benefits including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
* **Work Environment:** Collaborative and supportive work culture with opportunities for professional development.
* **Impact:** Play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our practice and making a meaningful difference in our community.

title: Director R&D Consumables
description:
**TITLE:**  Director R&D Consumables  
**TYPE:**  Direct Hire  
**LOCATION:** Asbury Park, NJ  
**ONSITE/REMOTE/HYBRID:** Onsite  
**START DATE:**  July/August 2024  
**SHIFT:**  Day Shift

We are looking for a Director of R&D Consumables. The Director of R&D for Consumables is pivotal in leading the charge for innovation within our pet product portfolio. This role is centered around spearheading product development initiatives, optimizing existing processes, and introducing cutting-edge technologies to achieve strategic business goals while fulfilling or surpassing consumer expectations. Managing a talented team of scientists, engineers, and technicians, along with close collaboration with essential stakeholders, is key to identifying research priorities, managing project timelines, and efficiently allocating resources.

**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Promote and integrate new and existing business processes to amplify their impact, advocating for continuous improvement.
* Spearhead innovation within the consumables segment, enhancing product offerings to meet evolving market demands.
* Uphold and exceed standards in product quality, formulation, and specifications to satisfy operational, regulatory, and consumer needs, with a keen eye on production economics.
* Direct the entire pet food product development lifecycle, from conceptualization to deployment.
* Champion innovative product development, transforming insights from experimental research and consumer behavior into successful market introductions.
* Foster interdepartmental collaboration to set benchmarks for product innovation success.
* Guarantee that products are produced and controlled in a manner consistent with quality standards within a GMP framework.
* Explore new avenues for innovation, focusing on claims, nutritional value, profitability, and sustainability, by staying abreast of industry trends, competitor products, and technological advances.
* Maintain strict compliance with all regulatory standards set forth by USDA, FDA, AAFCO, and FISMA for food manufacturing.
* Engage in organizational initiatives to further corporate objectives.
* Ensure adherence to environmental and safety regulations as mandated by the EPA and MPCA.

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

* Bachelor's Degree in Food Science, Food Chemistry, Cereal Technology, Food/Chemical Engineering, or a similar field. Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant scientific discipline highly desirable.
* A minimum of 5-10 years in product development within a dynamic Client setting.
* Prior experience in pet food development and knowledge in animal nutrition highly preferred.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite.
* Comprehensive understanding of regulatory and food safety principles.
* Demonstrated capability to lead a product development team towards achieving innovation and excellence, coupled with an entrepreneurial drive and results-focused mindset.
* Exceptional communication abilities, both verbally and in writing.
* Creativity, advanced technical skills, business acumen, and sound judgment.

title: Logistics Assistant
description:
About Us:

Sure Petcare is a leading provider of innovative pet care solutions, dedicated to enhancing the lives of pets and their owners. Our commitment to quality and customer satisfaction drives our success, and we are currently seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Logistics Assistant to join our dynamic team.

Job Description:

As a Logistics Assistant at Sure Petcare, you will support our logistics and supply chain operations by ensuring the efficient movement and management of products. Your organizational skills and attention to detail will be essential in helping us maintain our high standards of service.

Key Responsibilities:

- Assist in coordinating shipments and managing transportation logistics for incoming and outgoing products.

- Maintain accurate inventory records and track shipments in the logistics system.

- Prepare and process shipping documents, including labels and packing lists.

- Collaborate with suppliers, carriers, and internal teams to ensure timely delivery of products.

- Monitor inventory levels and assist with stock audits and replenishment.

- Address any shipping or logistics issues, providing solutions as needed.

- Support general administrative tasks related to logistics operations.

Qualifications:

- High school diploma or equivalent; additional education in logistics or supply chain management is a plus.

- Previous experience in logistics, shipping, or a related field is preferred.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Basic computer skills for inventory tracking and documentation.

- Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.

- Flexibility to work additional hours or adjust schedules as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.68 - $21.49 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Guest Service Agent
description:
#### **Overview**

**Opportunity: Guest Service Agent**



Greet, register and service guests in a friendly and courteous manner according to hotel/brand and sustainability standards.


**Your Growth Path**



Front Desk Supervisor or Sales Coordinator Front Office Manager or Sales Manager


**Your Focus**


* Immediately greet guests and offer to assist with their needs.
* Register and assign guests to hotel rooms.
* Establish methods of payment and verify credit.
* Make and confirm reservations.
* Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.
* Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or the PMS system.
* Respond to guest requests in a timely manner.
* Receive and resolve guest complaints, elevating to supervisor if necessary.
* Secure guests' valuables in hotel safe or safe-deposit boxes, if not available in guest rooms.
* Perform bookkeeping activities, such as balancing accounts and conducting audits.
* Be aware of guest satisfaction scores and work toward increasing departmental and overall guest satisfaction.
* Follow sustainability guidelines and practices related to HHMs EarthView program.
* Practice safe work habits, wear protective safety equipment and follow MSDS and OSHA standards.
* Assist in the breakfast area or assist guests with luggage when staffing assistance is required or during peak periods.
* Ensure overall guest satisfaction.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.


**Your Background and Skill**


* High School diploma or equivalent preferred.
* Previous customer service experience or equivalent training required.
* Knowledge of PMS systems preferred.


**Work Environment and Context**


* Work schedule varies and may include working on holidays, weekends and alternate shifts.
* Requires standing for extended periods, walking, pushing, lifting up to 25 pounds, bending and reaching; stooping, kneeling, or crouching.

title: Parts Sales Representative
description:
**Parts Sales Representative**

Chery Equipment Group

Garden City, New York, United States (On-site)

**Company Details:**

Chery Equipment Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial products.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Forklift, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products.

Our Chery Industrial division is looking for a customer service representative to handle after sales issues. The successful candidate will communicate with customers to determine replacement parts required, according to customers' descriptions of malfunctions and manufacturers.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Assist customers, such as responding to customer complaints and updating them about back-ordered parts
* Inform customers of estimated delivery schedules, service contracts, warranties, or other information pertaining to purchased products
* Communicate with customers via phone, email, and text message
* Collaborate with the Product Quality Manager to order parts from the manufacturers
* Support the sales team with customer service related tasks

**Qualifications:**

* Associate’s degree required, Bachelor’s degree (preferred)
* Proficient in the use of Google Suite and Excel
* Excellent communication skills; ability to effectively talk on the phone
* Customer service experience (required)

**Pay:** $20-$22

*Chery Equipment Group is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. Chery Equipment Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Chery Equipment Group conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

title: Innovation Insights Manager
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  


**Responsibilities**



Report to the Director of Innovation, collaborating with other innovation leaders to develop, manage, and deliver ways-in for key strategic growth spaces such as cream cheese and hard cheese.



Core responsibilities include:


* Conduct analysis and secondary research to identify opportunity areas, unsolved consumer tensions, competitive challenges, and macroeconomic shifts that could unleash business growth.
* Bring expertise in identifying emerging cultural trends and translating them into actionable strategies to drive innovation and competitive advantage
* Identify, align, and execute the learning agenda to unpack key opportunity areas across the 3 lenses.
* Drive 'make to learn' (prototyping) and 'do over say' evidence in every research stage to ensure solutions are vetted in a suitable environment.
* Succinctly help document and report all findings, pivots, opportunities, and implications to weekly leadership forums and executive key presentations.
* Act as ambassador for transforming the ways we think about our brand, our business model(s) and our ways of learning, and eventually how Violife / Upfield can innovate differently.
* Champion a future-forward mindset, acting as an Innovation role model within the larger Innovation / Marketing teams and inspiring Violife with the latest information on new trends in plant-based food, cheese & beyond.


**So, what does it take to be successful in this role?**


* Bachelor's degree or international equivalent
* Minimum of 8 years within **CPG or innovation agency/consultancy-type environment**
* **Experience in foods – dairy (e.g., milk, creamer, cheese, etc.) and plant-based a plus**


**What's next**



If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now!

title: Brand Manager - Country Crock
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  



Our North American business has been on an incredible growth journey for the past several years and has major ambitions to further step-change growth in the dynamic food category. We must attract the right people – those who love what they do, thrive on responsibility, and are looking for limitless career-defining opportunities.



We're looking to hire a Brand Manager to be part of the Country Crock brand, the biggest brand in our US portfolio. Country Crock is one the most iconic brands in the food industry, with a fantastic growth trajectory across spreads and creams categories!



As a Brand Manager reporting to the US Marketing Director, your focus will be on brand plan development, execution, and measurement. From leading creative development and marketing activation initiatives-to analyzing business performance and providing key insights, you will have a variety of opportunities to develop your marketing acumen and show leadership potential to further your career within the organization. The environment at Flora Food Group is fast-paced so you'll bring a dynamic and agile approach to work with the consumer and customer mindset at the core.


**Responsibilities**


* Own the development and execution of the overall annual communications strategy and marketing plan.
* Lead packaging creative design development for product innovations and renovations supporting the Innovation lead.
* Work with media agencies and colleagues at key digital platforms (eg. Facebook, Pinterest, Youtube) to develop test and scale approaches for audience-driven digital media.
* Create and execute custom content with digital publisher partners in the food and lifestyle space.
* Own our branded channel strategy including website and social media handles (FB, IG, Twitter, etc.).
* Lead partner agencies in planning and executing all customer shopper marketing activities and national consumer promotional strategies.
* Leverage marketing intelligence insights in conjunction with media agencies to synthesize and optimize activities in the areas of paid and owned media (tv, digital, social, website), with an eye towards learning and utilizing our data management platforms to extend our targeting capabilities.\\*
* Establish and maintain brand budget and drive efficiencies on an ongoing basis, working closely with external partners to optimize across and within channels.
* Stay on top of food trends as well as new marketing technology to assist with special marketing projects as needed to leverage innovative channels.
* Key responsibilities encompass Annual planning and ongoing brand business (brand health and consumption) operations, Innovation Execution, Campaign Management, Media strategy, activity planning, and ownership and planning of budgets.


**Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree required, MBA preferred
* 5-7 years of relevant experience (i.e. Project Management, Brand Management, Innovation Management, or Management Consulting in the food/consumer space)
* Passion for marketing communication and ability to identify and develop strong creativity.
* Love for food and a knowledge of food trends
* Strong project management and organizational skills
* Entrepreneurial mindset and an agile approach to work
* High level of interpersonal skills leading cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to influence others across functions
* Strong analytical skills and be able to opportunistically identify avenues for brand growth in emerging channels
* Organizational skills and attention to detail
* Proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint, (MS projects preferred)
* Experience using syndicated data resources preferred (i.e. Nielsen, IRI, SPINS)
* Proximity to Flora Food Group Hackensack office for hybrid working (roughly 3 days a week in office)
* Ability to travel 15% domestically and internationally


Compensation range: Base salary $140K to $155K based on experience, expertise, and other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors. The position includes annual bonus opportunity and other competitive health and welfare benefits.


**What's next**



If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now!

title: PR and Social Media Manager
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  


**Hybrid - Hackensack, NJ 2X week with shuttle support from NYC**



The Violife PR & Social Media Manager will play a key role on our US marketing team. You will be accountable for the planning and implementation of multi-channel brand strategies to drive profitable growth in our portfolio of dairy-free products. You will have the opportunity to demonstrate your expertise in tapping into culture, strategic thinking, creative development, project management, and execution excellence in a fast-paced environment.



You'll be working closely with the integrated agency team on the brands' Creative, PR, Social Media, Shopper Marketing, and Paid Media strategies and activities. In addition, you will collaborate with the broader US and global marketing team to develop and drive integrated go-to-market plans.


This position will have one direct report.


**Responsibilities**


* Lead earned & owned media activation in the USA
* Own Violife "Big Bet" brand activation across earned (PR), media (organic social and paid media) as well as partnerships (influencers, entertainment properties, and more)
* Leverage cultural prowess & social media listening tools to develop ideas that insert the brand into cultural moments in real-time – both proactively and reactively
* Drive marketing "test and learn" agenda to measure marketing resource efficiency and effectiveness (awareness, trial, conversion)
* Execute IRL activations (cultural events, in-store, food service, online) as a brand-building vehicle
* Engage directly with our Violife digital community including social community management, influencer communication, and partner outreach, creating a cult-like fan base that is obsessed with us as much as we are with them


Commercial execution


* Allocate and manage the Violife Brand Budget, and drive efficiencies on an ongoing basis, working closely with external and internal partners to optimize between working and non-working expenses
* Collaborate with innovation and trade marketing teams to bring the product innovation plan to market by creating compelling sell stories for customers and ensuring the seamless integration of innovative product benefits, and brand positioning into marketing campaigns.
* Develop strong marketing storylines for the Upfield sales team to leverage in sell-in, including hard-hitting performance insights from real-time data sources (eg. Nielsen)
* Deliver annual brand review and develop 2025 marketing plan that translates into customer and channel plans with support from a cross-functional team.
* Work closely with compliance teams to ensure that all marketing materials and communications adhere to legal and regulatory requirements
* Coach and guide a direct report, developing their skill set to become increasingly independent in their role


**Requirements**


* 3-4+ years of relevant PR & Social Media experience (i.e. brand management, start-up experience in the food/consumer space) Trailblazer with a Day 1 mindset. Driven, entrepreneurial, and creative
* A heart to always be learning and asking questions with a strong personal growth mindset
* Passion for social media trends, creators, and algorithms, with an emphasis on TikTok and Instagram
* Consumer-centric; out-of-the-box thinker; insurgent and entrepreneurial spirit
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, quick-shifting atmosphere with ease and poise
* Analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability and passion to derive insights from data
* Disciplined project management and organizational skills
* Proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint
* Experience in the US market required
* Bachelor's degree required
* Passion for the vision for a better tomorrow with delicious animal-free cheese!


You are a proactive self-starter, operate with a sense of urgency, initiate innovative or 'out of the box' ideas, and have a creative and entrepreneurial spirit. You're intrinsically motivated to work under pressure to set and meet deadlines while motivating our overall team to achieve mutual goals, both local and global.


**What's Next**  

  

If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now!

title: Financial Analyst- Overheads
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  



Location: Hackensack



Hybrid - 2X per week



Salary- 75-90K

  


**About the position**



In this role you will be responsible for maintaining the day-to-day Overheads activities for USA and CAN. This includes budgeting and building relationships with other department leaders to be able to reach success.


**Overheads Management**


* Partner with Cross functional Department owners to plan, forecast and understand Overhead costs
* Responsible for creating the annual operating budget.
* Monitor development of Overhead expenses throughout the month and at month end close.
* Reconcile GL activity and process journal entries in the form of accruals or reclasses.
* Provide insights to the FP&A team on actual spend vs budget.
* Analyze financial results and key trends to assess risk & opportunities and communicate to the controller and CFO.
* Responsible for alignment across functions of month-end closure and forecasting timelines
* Prepare and submit monthly Overheads forecast in financial planning system - SAP Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC) Software
* Build and maintain effective working relationships with different departments key players to ensure that expenses are posted correctly.
* Prepare monthly Overhead reports and share them with department leaders.
* Consolidation of monthly, quarterly, and yearly reporting.
* Work closely with various global teams including 3rd party service providers.
* Submit R&D, Legal, IT and Communications recharges to global.
* Implement process and improvement in areas where we can improve efficiency.
* Oversight of insurance, 401K and payroll requirements including maintenance of the prepaid schedules, completion of annual forms and invoicing.


**General**


* Support Controllers team on month end close processes including reconciliations of accruals, posting payroll entries, benefits group reporting and treasury reporting
* Assist with the internal and external audit processes
* Provide assistance on new projects and initiatives


**Minimum Requirements**


* Degree in accounting, finance or equivalent;
* +5 years of experience in accounting
* Excellent analytical and communication skills with ability to respond under pressure
* Ability to meet deadlines and enforce time management
* Flexible and open minded, quick to adapt to changing requirements
* Very strong work ethic and reliable
* Strong analytical skills
* Strong system knowledge: (SAP (S4 Hana), BPC, Power BI, AFO, Microsoft Office, MS Excel)


**About you!**



You'll have to enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and it will take hard work and determination; we will give you the ownership you need to make an impact.



You'll have to deliver on the commitments you make. And we'll give you the freedom and flexibility to do your job and build your own career.

  


**What's next**



If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now!

Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  



Hybrid - 2-3x per week in the office with shuttle service for NYC-based employees



As the Innovation Marketing Manager at Violife, you will spearhead the strategy and execution of new product launches. Your leadership will extend through multiple functional areas, aligning efforts with R&D, sales, insights, and supply chain teams to ensure that each new product not only reaches the market but also thrives in it.



This is the perfect opportunity for a dynamic leader who excels in project execution and market strategy, all while navigating the complexities of product commercialization. You will guide our innovative products from factory to shelf, making critical decisions that will impact their success and contribute towards Violife's future growth.


**Responsibilites**


* Enable growth via flawless commercialization of Fewer, Bigger, Faster innovation – driving continuous improvement across all Innovation Governance & Commercialization KPIs
* Provide world-class Commercial Project Management, delivering creative solutions that add value & ensure flawless execution
* Oversee the stage-gate process, ensuring that each project phase is completed on time, within budget, and meets the necessary quality standards.
* Develop & manage the Innovation Hopper & Pipeline – value, resources –, facilitating comprehensive risk & trade-off assessments, and managing escalation processes to address potential issues proactively.
* Systematically focus on driving synergies and minimizing duplication & low-value add activity.
* Partner with key stakeholders across product development, marketing, sales, and operations to align objectives, timelines, and deliverables.
* Track and analyze the performance of launched products, providing insights for continuous improvement and future product developments.


**Qualifications**


* A minimum of 8+ years of leadership experience, with a track record of successful product launches
* Proven experience in product development and commercialization, preferably in the CPG or food & beverage industry
* Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, able to lead and motivate teams across different departments
* Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Intimate knowledge of key retailer business practices
* Exceptional communication skills, capable of leading conversations for both internal teams and external partners
* A bias toward action, especially within a lean team and fast-paced environment

title: R&D Manager - Commercialization
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  



Hybrid - 2-3x a week in the office with shuttle service for NYC-based employees



Compensation: Base salary $125K to $140K based on experience, expertise, and other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors. The position includes annual bonus opportunities and other competitive health and welfare benefits.



This role is for an R&D leader to take our industry-leading products, technologies, and know-how and to help them reach their potential in these alternate channels. Within a profitable industry, Flora Food Group is focused on a long-term strategy: driving growth through innovation. With a fresh leadership team, we have defined a different agenda, underpinned by bold innovation. In the retail channel in North America, Flora Food Group is the undisputed leader in dairy-free, plant-based butter, cheeses, and creams. With large, category-leading brands like *Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter,* and *Becel*, Flora Food Group is driving innovation and growth in retail customers all over North America. However, retail only presents a part of the growth ambition of Flora Food Group. There are huge opportunities for our products in other channels such as food service, industrial, and private label that we have only begun to scratch the surface.


**Responsibilities**


* The person in this role will work closely with Flora Food Group Customer Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Global R&D Product Design teams to:
* Develop customer and consumer insights to guide innovation growth program.
* identify potential growth opportunities and strategies by channel
* Evaluate Flora Food Group's product portfolio for the best possible product fit for each opportunity
* Initiate development briefs for new product solutions when appropriate
* Actively work with our field sales teams to demonstrate the benefits of Flora Food Group product solutions and to close sales
* Work collaboratively to develop strategic partnerships with key customers
* Serve as Technical Project Leader on projects involving rollout of existing technologies.
* Lead a small team of R&D Project leaders and technologists.
* Coordinate product and packaging development with the global R&D channel growth team as well as the global product and pack design team.
* Maintain and build a strong network of industrial and food service contacts.


In this role, you will inject passion and bring strong initiative to make a hugely positive impact to the way R&D delivers and innovates on both short and long-term business goals for growth in these channels. You will be encouraged to bring new insights, approaches and innovative technologies to the business to further strengthen Flora Food Group R&D team.


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree in Food Science or Engineering with a passion for food.
* 10+ years of experience in Food Product Development R&D with considerable experience leading both R&D and cross-functional teams, experience in FMCG is essential.
* Technical experience and know-how in plant-based food technologies such as vegetable fats and oils, proteins, emulsification, and water structuring are a plus.
* Excellent communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate technology to both internal stakeholders and team members and external customers.
* Significant experience working in the food service and industrial (business to business) channels.
* Demonstrable skill in managing product innovation from ideas to launch including the identification, development and delivery of impactful business and consumer optimized product innovations.
* Experience in overseeing products in market, maintaining and growing existing base business, as well as driving productivity and cost


**What's next**



If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now!

title: Associate Creative Director
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  


**Position Overview:**



At Flora Food Group, our mission is to enhance health and happiness through delicious, plant-based nutrition products. We are seeking an **Associate Creative Director** to lead the creative strategy and execution for the global Violife brand. This role will be a key player in the Design and Consumer Experience Hub, reporting directly to the Head of Design and Consumer Experience.



As an Associate Creative Director, you will collaborate closely with the internal Design Team and external partners to deliver impactful, innovative brand experiences. This role requires a blend of creative leadership and hands-on design execution, ensuring that ideas are brought to life with precision and excellence across all touchpoints. You will be instrumental in crafting and executing compelling visual narratives that resonate on both global and local levels, maintaining a balance between creative direction and hands-on design involvement.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Customer Insight:** Develop a deep understanding of customers and craft memorable, end-to-end brand experiences that resonate with their needs and desires.
* **Strategic Vision and Execution:** Balance long-term creative strategies with short-term impactful activations, ensuring both are executed to a high standard. Your role will require hands-on design involvement to bring ideas to life.
* **Creative Leadership:** Lead and inspire creative teams across various workstreams, ensuring alignment with the brand's vision while remaining actively involved in design execution.
* **Design Excellence:** Deliver world-class creative work by overseeing the entire design process—from concept to execution—ensuring high standards in both direction and design output.
* **Toolkit Development:** Develop comprehensive brand and activation toolkits with clear guidelines, ensuring consistency across all consumer touchpoints.
* **Visual Storytelling:** Create and execute compelling visual stories across mixed media, ensuring cohesive brand narratives at every stage of the consumer journey.
* **Brand Language:** Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define and codify brand language across various mediums, including visual and sensory elements.
* **Creative Process Management:** Manage the entire creative process from brief to final delivery, with a strong focus on both design direction and hands-on execution of key design elements.
* **Design Element Definition:** Define all design components, including identity, typography, iconography, illustrations, animations, and more. Ensure meticulous attention to detail in the selection of design materials and finishes.
* **Project Management:** Ensure that creative projects are delivered on time and on budget, balancing creativity with effective project management to produce world-class results.
* **External Collaboration:** Work closely with freelancers, agencies, and external partners as needed to extend creative capabilities and ensure flawless execution.


**Experience and Skills Required:**


* **Proven Experience:** Significant experience in creative leadership roles, such as Associate Creative Director, Senior Designer, or Art Director, with a robust portfolio showcasing a blend of creative direction and hands-on design execution.
* **Graphic Design Skills:** Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), with a strong foundation in design principles, typography, color theory, and layout.
* **Digital Expertise:** Familiarity with digital design, including social media, web design, and video editing. Knowledge of 3D rendering or prototyping tools is a plus.
* **Print and Production Knowledge:** Experience managing print production processes, color management, and collaborating with vendors to ensure high-quality packaging and material execution.
* **Design Versatility:** Ability to visualize and execute brand identity across various formats, including packaging, digital, and environmental design.


**Desired Traits:**


* **Creative Leadership:** A visionary thinker who can inspire creative teams while actively contributing to design execution.
* **Collaboration:** Strong ability to work across functions, leading creative initiatives and ensuring alignment with strategic goals.
* **Innovation and Curiosity:** A quick-thinking, entrepreneurial spirit with a passion for innovation and pushing creative boundaries.


This role offers an exciting opportunity to influence the Violife brand on a global scale, contributing to our mission to enhance health and happiness through plant-based nutrition. If you are a creative visionary with a passion for transformative design, we invite you to apply.



Flora Food Group is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: FP&A Supply Chain Controller
description:
**About Flora Food Group**



We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.



Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

  



Location: Hackensack, NJ



Hybrid - 2X per week

  


**NA SC FP&A Manager**


**Job Purpose**


Your key role as North America Supply Chain FP&A Manager, reporting into the Head of Global SC FP&A, is to business partner with the regional SC Finance and commercial teams and enhance business outcomes by providing crucial financial insights, maintaining financial discipline, and leading the regional month end close, budgeting, forecasting processes.


**Performance Management**


* Business partner to Head of SCF NA and market finance and continuously enhance the business performance by challenging assumptions, supporting decision-making, and providing insights and analysis through development of analytics capabilities and market awareness.
* Steering monthly/quarterly forecasting and annual budget planning and analytics. Ensure regular handshakes between key stakeholders for on time in full delivery
* Being fully involved in the finance month-close process, own data and ensure data integrity and be the linking pin between regional SC Finance and regional FP&A team
* Deliver regional performance letters to share findings including business improvement recommendations.
* In Upfield, Value Creation (VC) is one of the key elements for the performance delivery. This role will be responsible for tracking, monitoring, and consolidating NA VC projects and be the first point of contact for VC related projects
* You will work on what-if scenarios in connection with the Market and Supply Chain network change
* Work on enhancements to the existing tools and reporting to facilitate decision making
* Navigate and build relationships with key stakeholders. Be a team player and a positive influence on others.

  


**Controls, Accounting & Governance**


* Maintain integrity of the data reported
* Key point of contact for SC Finance and SC Financial Services to liaise with on budgets and forecasts ensuring that all deadlines are achieved
* Work internally within SC NA Finance team to understand actuals vs forecast/budget and explain key variances & drivers of performance
* Build relationships with market finance and


**About you!**


* Finance business partnering experience in Consumer Goods industry with proven ability to deliver insights and results
* Proven ability to work in a multi-functional organisation with varied stakeholders (seniority, functional mix)
* Professional Accounting qualification
* Experience working in a SAP environment and with BPC
* Strong influencing and communication skills
* Delivery-focussed with a high degree of ownership and a positive, growth mindset
* Collaborative and team-orientated mindset
* Resilience and ability to manage and navigate through change and uncertainty
* Insurgent mindset and passion to identify and deliver profitable, growth opportunities

  



You'll have to enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and it will take hard work and determination; we will give you the ownership you need to make an impact.



You'll have to deliver on the commitments you make. And we'll give you the freedom and flexibility to do your job and build your own career.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Executive Assistant**

Chery Group

Garden City, NY (on-site)

**Company Details**

Chery Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial products.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Equipment Group, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products. The company's business scope includes the sale and leasing of various construction and material handling equipment. With the rapid growth and development of the company, we look for strong, energetic individuals to join our team to grow together with us.

Chery Industrial is in search of a proactive and resourceful administrative professional to assist the CEO with daily office functions. The ideal candidate will be organized and bilingual in English and Mandarin.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Manage email correspondence by organizing and filtering incoming messages effectively.
* Handle incoming mail and oversee deliveries while maintaining an organized system for sorting.
* Collaborate with the IT department to address and resolve employee concerns regarding computer systems, internet access, and telecommunications.
* Assist in procurement processes and oversee the management of office supplies and service requests.
* Support management in planning and executing special events.
* Retrieve reports from the company's ERP system and compile them for presentation to the CEO and finance manager.
* Manage and organize calendars efficiently.

**Qualifications:**

* **Bilingual in Mandarin and English**
* **Willingness to travel as needed**
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in office management, administrative or executive assistant roles.
* Proficient in communication with a strong emphasis on both written and verbal skills.
* Demonstrated expertise in Microsoft Office and G-Suite applications.
* Proven ability to manage and excel in a high-volume work environment.

title: Job Coach (Special Needs) - Brooklyn & Manhattan
description:
**Company Description**  

AHRC New York City is one of the largest providers of services for children and adults with developmental disabilities in New York City. Our mission is to advocate for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to lead full and equitable lives. Come join our team and discover your passion.

 **Job Description** ***AHRC New York City is seeking Job Coach's for the Employment Business Services (EBS) program in Brooklyn and Manhattan.*** **The starting pay rate for this position is between $17-$18 per hour. Pay rate maybe increased to $18-$19 after 6 months pending review process. In addition, this position comes with a very generous benefit package which includes FULL MEDICAL INS. PAID BY AHRC NYC...NO COST TO YOU! vision and dental plans, generous paid time off, commuter benefits, tuition assistance, a 403(b)retirement plan with a matching benefit, health savings accounts, and other discount programs.**

**Scope of Position:**


The Job Coach is the central figure in the success of our workers with disabilities in their jobs. Job Coaches provide training, evaluation and counseling to workers with disabilities in a wide variety of jobs at independent businesses, or through contracts AHRC holds with various entities. The job requires a high degree of scheduling flexibility. It is at times necessary to modify a staff schedule during the week with only minimal notification.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Assess workers’ skills, abilities, needs for support and learning styles and design and implement training plans that will meet their needs.
* Teach, assist and support new workers in their jobs through a variety of techniques including demonstration of work/tasks, modeling, counseling, observation and discussion.
* Travel routing new workers from home to job site.
* Development of excellent relationships with workers and their families and significant others and employers, co-workers, referral and funding sources and to provide excellent service to all these customers.
* Documentation of all services rendered in accordance with all AHRC, City/State/Federal guidelines and policies and maintenance of person specific program files in compliance with same.
* On Hudson River Services sites (AHRC’s affirmative business), Job Coaches’ duties are expanded to include coordination of time cards, supplies and other site management responsibilities (see HRS training manual).

 **Qualifications**  

* One year experience working with individuals with disabilities is preferred.
* Flexibility in work hours and ability to respond to the scheduling needs of the individual. May include early morning, evening and/or weekend hours.
* Knowledge of Home and Community Based Waiver, and the ability to keep up to date pertaining to such knowledge, and interpret same.
* Understanding of Person Centered Planning.
* Ability to establish and maintain a working relationship with program participants, families, staff and community agencies.
* Ability to communicate both orally and in written form in English.
* Ability to organize work with self and others.
* High School diploma or GED

  

**Additional Information** **Benefits:**

* **Full Medical Ins. Paid by Company (Single & Family Plans)**
* Generous Paid time off (sick, personal & vacation)
* Paid Training
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Referral program
* 403(b) retirement plan
* 403(b) company match
* Life insurance
* Employee discount
* Health savings account

**Schedule:** 8 hour shift


AHRC New York City is an Equal Opportunity Employer We consider applicants for all positions without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, gender, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, disability, marital status, partnership status, military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking, genetic information, or unemployment or any other protected characteristic under federal, state or local law.

description:

title: Customer Service/Call Center Part-Time
description:
Are you interested in taking your career to the next step with an industry leader? We have just the opportunity for you! We are a leading home services provider and due to our continued growth we are looking for personable and reliable individuals to serve as Customer Service Representatives. You will handle inbound and outbound customer service calls from an established customer base while answering questions and providing consultation on pricing, service plans and billing issues.

Our focus is on providing exceptional customer care first and foremost. You will be empowered to do what it takes to help each customer. We offer competitive compensation and benefits for full time roles, as well as overtime opportunities during the busy winter season. You may also find room for advancement with us. If this sounds like the kind of career move you have wanted to make and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!

Responsibilities:  
As a Customer Service Representative, you will take incoming calls from our customers and make outbound customer calls for follow-up and upselling purposes. Above all, you will use your communication and active listening skills to provide customers with exceptional service.

Specific duties include:

* Preparing account changes
* Troubleshooting and resolving customer issues
* Identifying and acting upon potential new sales opportunities
* Assisting with customer retention
* Working with other departments to ensure timely resolution of customer issues
* Negotiating customer prices, service plan payments and billing issues consistent with specified company guidelines

Requirements:

As a Customer Service Representative, you must be pleasant and professional with an engaging personality and possess the ability to function equally well both independently and in a team environment. You must be detail oriented and focused, with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and active listening skills, along with the ability to interact effectively with both customers and coworkers.

Specific qualifications include:

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* 1-2 years in a customer-facing role; prior experience in a customer service setting preferred
* Ability to work well in a fast paced environment
* Excellent telephone skills
* Strong troubleshooting abilities
* Solid negotiating skills
* Computer proficient
* Must be flexible for weekday and weekend shifts

Benefits:

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are one of the main keys to our continued success, therefore, we are committed to your professional development and you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility within our organization.

Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:

* Medical coverage (F/T staff)
* Dental coverage (F/T staff)
* Retirement Savings
* Plus more!

Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!

Apply now!

The hourly pay rate is $18.50 per hour.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.50 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Lead Strategic Partnerships Manager, Americas
description:
### **About GetYourGuide**



GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.


### **Team mission:**



We are searching for an outstanding **Lead Strategic Partnerships Manager** to establish, maintain, and grow affiliate partnerships with some of the world's leading brands in the Americas. The role reports to the Head of Partnerships, Americas, and will play a pivotal role in growing GetYourGuide's market share in the U.S., our fastest-growing region.


### **You will:**


* Strategically expand our Americas affiliate partner portfolio while owning, managing, and growing a multi-million dollar portfolio of enterprise accounts and industry relationships
* Build a strong pipeline of exceptional affiliate partnership prospects that offer the growth potential to grow the U.S. GMV contribution by 5X
* Contribute to the design of, and execute playbooks, sales, and growth systems needed to penetrate strategic verticals
* Develop strong internal partnerships and collaborate cross-functionally to maximize revenue opportunities to improve deal progressions
* Be accountable for selling to existing customers and net new customers
* Work closely with Legal, FP&A, Partner Tech, Supply, Accounting, Product, and Brand and Growth Marketing Teams to build feasible partnership structures, ensure compliance with contractual terms and achievement of partnership milestones, and maximize the impact of the GetYourGuide brand.
* Regularly communicate strategies, impact, learnings, and next steps to GetYourGuide leadership via weekly, monthly, and quarterly business updates.
* Represent GetYourGuide by interfacing with business leaders in an acute business setting (sales pitches, ongoing partner meetings, etc) and at industry events such as conferences, and trade shows and through participation in local trade associations.

### **Who you are:**


* Based in the **NYC** metropolitan area or willing to relocate. We operate on a hybrid work model and value in person interaction in our office 3+ days per week.
* 6+ years experience working in sales, key account management, or business development functions at high-growth marketplace, SaaS, or e-commerce companies
* Connected, have a good network and reputation
* Proficient and have a good understanding of affiliate marketing
* Good business acumen and commercial instincts, specifically in contract negotiation and relationship management
* An understanding of online marketplace dynamics, with demonstrated success in driving growth, tangible results, and KPI improvements
* Entrepreneurial attitude to win despite all challenges, thriving in a fast-paced environment, growth mindset, and learners attitude
* Highly collaborative, outstanding communication, negotiation, persuasion, and interpersonal skills with a strong win-win mentality and natural ability to build relationships
* Data-driven, results-oriented, and accurate
* Excited to spend up to 30% of your time traveling
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

### **How we set you up for success:**


* 20 vacation days to start (plus one additional day per year of tenure up to 23 days)
* 13 public holidays off
* 10 paid sick days per year
* 401(k) plan plus company matching
* 12 weeks 100% paid parental leave
* Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
* Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
* Various commuter benefits. Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
* Fitness benefits
* Full coverage medical plan options
* 100% employer paid dental and vision for employees and their dependents
* 100% employer paid life and short term disability
* HSA and FSA plans
* Voluntary additional life, disability, special disease and accident insurance
* Thrive in a dynamic work environment as part of a multinational team (Headquarters in Germany; work language is English)
* GetYourGuide vouchers and friends & family discount to experience our products for yourself


And more...



The reasonably estimated salary for this role ranges from $154,000 - $163,000, plus a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience.

  


### **We look forward to hearing from you**



Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.


### **We are an equal-opportunity employer**



Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


### **Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams**



We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.
