title: Scarsdale Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 9/9/24  




Part-time, $20/hour position available at our brand new farmers market in Scarsdale. Work hours are weekly on Sundays from 7am-3pm at the market, located at the intersection of Spencer Road and Chase Place, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.  

APPLY NOW


-


Down to Earth Markets is a mission-driven Benefit Corporation and Certified B Corporation using business as a power for positive change in the world.


All employment decisions that Down to Earth makes are based on organizational needs, job requirements and the employee's or applicant's qualifications. We are an equal opportunity employer. All job applicants are welcome regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.


  
### **If you're interested in one of the above opportunities, email your cover letter and résumé to** **[email protected]****.**

title: Insurance Sales Trainee
description:
Job Description

In collaboration with our customer partners (independent retail agents or wholesale brokers), we are seeking energetic, dynamic, competitive individuals who are passionate about sales and ready to jump-start their careers in the insurance industry. Successful candidates will be hired for agent and marketing representative roles with top brokers and insurance agencies around the country and enrolled in an unparalleled training-and-development program for their first two years. The program is designed to develop candidates into elite salespeople who can develop meaningful business relationships, drive results and build a long-term career in the industry. Accepted program participant receives a detailed training plan outlining expectations and how the companies will invest in their development, and they will be assigned a dedicated sales mentor who will provide one-on-one coaching and support. As part of a national program, participants also have the opportunity to network with other participants, who are also launching their careers, from around the country.

Job requirements:

* Strong organizational and communication skills
* A track record of success building relationships
* An eagerness to learn and a desire for coaching
* A positive attitude
* Local and overnight travel may be required

*The 50/50 Program is a* collaboration *between USLI and select customer partners (independent retail agents or wholesale brokers). We are always accepting applications for this program**,\\_* due to the variety of openings around the country. Candidates should be prepared for a challenge, as the program is rigorous but equally rewarding for those who complete it. Please note: *\\_**This is not a fully remote position.*** *Salary range of $40,000.00 to $60,000.00.* 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person
company_description: USLI, a member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, is an A++ rated company underwriting insurance for small businesses.

title: Finance Director
description:
Our client, a prestigious private banking institution with a global presence, is seeking an experienced Finance Director to join their leadership team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive financial strategy and performance in the dynamic world of private banking and wealth management.
  
The Finance Director will be responsible for overseeing all financial operations of the private banking division, providing strategic financial leadership, and ensuring the bank's financial health and compliance with regulatory requirements. This role requires a deep understanding of the private banking sector, strong analytical skills, and the ability to translate complex financial data into actionable insights for senior management.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and implement financial strategies aligned with the bank's overall business objectives
* Lead the budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning processes for the private banking division
* Oversee financial reporting, including the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements
* Manage the division's capital and liquidity positions in compliance with regulatory requirements
* Provide financial analysis and insights to support decision-making on new products, services, and markets
* Lead pricing strategies for private banking products and services
* Oversee the financial aspects of client portfolios and investment performance reporting
* Manage relationships with external auditors, regulators, and other financial stakeholders
* Develop and maintain robust financial controls and risk management processes
* Lead and develop a team of finance professionals, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement
* Collaborate with other departments to drive operational efficiencies and cost management initiatives
* Participate in mergers, acquisitions, and other strategic initiatives from a financial perspective


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred
* Professional qualification such as CPA, CA, CFA, or equivalent
* 10+ years of progressive experience in finance, with at least 5 years in senior roles within the banking or financial services sector
* Strong knowledge of private banking regulations, Basel III requirements, and international accounting standards (IFRS and US GAAP)
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex financial data into strategic insights
* Strong leadership and communication abilities, with experience managing cross-functional teams
* Proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and data analytics tools
* Solid understanding of wealth management products and services


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience in multiple areas of banking (e.g., retail, commercial, investment banking)
* Knowledge of fintech innovations and their impact on private banking
* Multilingual capabilities
* Experience with digital transformation initiatives in finance


**Benefits:**  

Attractive base salary commensurate with experience ($200k - $220k)
  
Performance-based annual bonus
  
Long-term incentive plan
  
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
  
Retirement savings plan with employer match
  
Generous paid time off and holiday schedule
  
Professional development opportunities and support for continuing education
  
Life and disability insurance
  
Employee assistance program

title: Clinical CMC Finance Director
description:
Our client, an innovative fintech company at the forefront of digital financial solutions, is seeking a Clinical CMC Finance Director to join their team. This role combines expertise in finance with an understanding of product development and regulatory compliance in the fintech industry.
  
The Clinical CMC Finance Director will be responsible for overseeing the financial aspects of the company's product development lifecycle, from conception through clinical testing and regulatory approval to market launch. This role requires a unique blend of financial acumen, understanding of fintech product development processes, and knowledge of regulatory requirements in the financial services industry.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Lead financial planning and analysis for the company's product development pipeline
* Develop and manage budgets for product development projects, including clinical testing phases
* Collaborate with product development teams to ensure financial viability of new fintech solutions
* Oversee cost management and financial risk assessment for product development initiatives
* Develop financial models to forecast costs and revenues associated with new products
* Analyze and report on financial performance of products in development and clinical testing phases
* Ensure compliance with financial regulations related to product development and testing
* Manage relationships with external partners, including financial institutions and regulatory bodies
* Provide financial insights to support go/no-go decisions in the product development process
* Develop and implement financial controls and processes for the product development lifecycle
* Prepare and present financial reports to senior management and board members
* Collaborate with other departments to align product development finances with overall company strategy


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or Master's degree preferred
* Professional qualification such as CPA, CFA, or equivalent is a bonus
* 10+ years of experience in finance roles, with at least 5 years in product development finance
* Strong understanding of fintech product development processes and regulatory environment
* Experience with financial modeling and analysis in a product development context
* Knowledge of clinical testing processes and associated financial implications
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong leadership and communication abilities
* Proficiency in financial software and data analysis tools


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience in both finance and technology sectors
* Familiarity with agile development methodologies and their financial implications
* Knowledge of international financial regulations and compliance requirements
* Experience with blockchain technology and cryptocurrency-related products


**Benefits:**  

Competitive salary commensurate with experience ($230k - $250k)

title: Construction Finance Manager
description:
Join our client, as a Construction Finance Manager! In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the financial operations within the construction industry. Your primary focus will be on managing the financial aspects of construction projects, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting. You will collaborate closely with project managers and other stakeholders to ensure the financial success of each project.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and manage project budgets, ensuring accuracy and adherence to financial goals.
* Monitor project costs and financial performance, identifying potential risks and opportunities.
* Prepare and present financial reports to project teams and senior management.
* Review and analyze project contracts to ensure compliance with financial requirements.
* Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to resolve financial issues and discrepancies.
* Provide financial guidance and support to project managers and team members.
* Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in construction finance.


**Requirements:**  

* At least 5-7 years of experience in finance, preferably in the construction industry.
* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of construction finance and project accounting principles.
* Proficiency in financial analysis, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Excellent attention to detail and highly organized.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in finance software and Microsoft Excel.


**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary package. ($140k - $150k)

title: Finance and Operations Director
description:
**About the Company:**  

Our client is a leading business consulting firm dedicated to helping organizations optimize their performance and achieve sustainable growth. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Finance and Operations Director to join their team and play a pivotal role in shaping the company's financial strategy and operational excellence.
  
  

**Job Overview:**  

The Finance and Operations Director will be responsible for overseeing all financial and operational aspects of the company, ensuring its continued growth and success. This role requires a strategic thinker with a strong background in finance, accounting, and operations management within the consulting industry.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee all aspects of financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting
* Manage cash flow and maintain strong relationships with banking partners

* Provide financial analysis and insights to support decision-making at the executive level
* Operational Leadership
* Optimize operational processes to enhance efficiency and productivity across the organization
* Develop and implement policies and procedures to streamline operations
* Oversee project management and resource allocation to maximize profitability
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure smooth integration of financial and operational strategies
* Team Management

* Recruit, train, and develop high-performing team members
* Strategic Planning

* Strong financial acumen and ability to translate complex financial data into actionable insights

title: Finance Manager
description:
Our client, a leading company in the financial industry, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Finance Manager to join their team. As the Finance Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the company, providing strategic financial insights and guidance to senior management, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations and accounting standards.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Manage and oversee the company's financial operations, including financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Develop and implement financial policies, procedures, and internal controls to ensure effective and efficient financial management.
* Monitor and analyze financial performance, providing recommendations to improve profitability and efficiency.
* Prepare financial reports, including monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support business strategies and initiatives.
* Manage relationships with external stakeholders, including auditors, regulators, and financial institutions.
* Ensure compliance with local and international financial regulations and accounting standards.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to the finance team.
* Stay updated with industry trends and changes in financial regulations.


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance, Master of Business Administration preferred.
* Professional certifications such as CPA or CMA are required.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in financial management.
* Strong knowledge of financial management principles and practices.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to communicate complex financial concepts effectively.
* Experience in budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
* Proficient in financial software and MS Office.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

title: Sustainable Finance Director
description:
**Company Overview:** Our client, a prestigious financial institution, is seeking a highly skilled Sustainable Finance Director to join their team in a leadership role. As a market leader in sustainable finance, they are committed to driving positive environmental and social impact through their financial products and services. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a forward-thinking organization that is dedicated to creating a more sustainable future.
  
**Role Overview:** As the Sustainable Finance Director, you will play a key role in developing and implementing the company's sustainable finance strategy. You will be responsible for leading the integration of sustainable finance principles into the company's operations and investment decisions, ensuring alignment with global sustainability goals and best practices. Additionally, you will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the adoption of sustainable finance practices across the industry.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and implement the company's sustainable finance strategy, in line with global sustainability goals and best practices.
* Ensure integration of sustainable finance principles into the company's operations and investment decisions.
* Lead the development of sustainable finance products and services, including green bonds, sustainability-linked loans, and impact investment funds.
* Collaborate with internal teams to embed sustainability considerations into risk management, due diligence, and reporting processes.
* Stay up to date with regulatory developments and industry trends in sustainable finance.
* Engage with external stakeholders, including clients, regulators, and industry groups, to promote sustainable finance practices.
* Oversee the measurement and reporting of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) performance.
* Provide guidance and training to internal teams on sustainable finance concepts and practices.
* Contribute to thought leadership and industry publications on sustainable finance.


**Requirements:**  

* Master's degree in finance, economics, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in sustainable finance or related roles.
* In-depth knowledge of sustainable finance principles, standards, and best practices.
* Familiarity with international sustainability frameworks, such as the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD).
* Proven track record in developing and implementing sustainable finance strategies.
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* Ability to think strategically and drive organizational change.
* Experience in financial modeling and impact assessment methodologies.
* Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.
* Passion for sustainability and a strong commitment to driving positive change.


If you are a visionary leader with a deep understanding of sustainable finance, and you are looking for a meaningful opportunity to make a difference, we invite you to apply with your updated resume.

* Competitive salary package. ($170k - $190k)

title: Director of Corporate Finance

* Develop and implement financial strategies to support the company's growth objectives.
* Oversee budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and analysis.
* Evaluate investment opportunities and provide recommendations.
* Monitor and manage cash flows and working capital.
* Ensure compliance with financial regulations and ethics.
* Lead and develop a high-performing team of finance professionals.


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field; MBA preferred.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in corporate finance or a similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of financial analysis, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent leadership and team management abilities.

title: Oak Street - Passaic- Van Driver
description:
Van Driver Needed for Healthcare Facility



HPH Transport is now hiring a van driver to work with local healthcare facilities! HPH Transport is dedicated to providing the safest, most reliable, most accommodating medical transportation services for patients.



HPH Transport provides Flexible Schedules, Competitive Pay and Advancement Opportunities! We select only the best qualified candidates, who are hardworking and dedicated to the job!



Requirements:


* Have an Excellent Driving Record
* 3 years minimum shuttle-type vehicle driving experience
* CDL license preferred but not required
* Previous Customer Service Experience
* Outgoing, Personable, and Courteous Personality

title: Investment Specialist - Naples
description:
Our client, a boutique wealth management firm, is seeking a licensed and experienced Financial Advisor to join their team in Naples, Florida. As a Financial Advisor, you will be responsible for providing financial planning and investment advice to clients. The firm specializes in making unique portfolios made up of stocks and bonds. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in bringing in new clients, closing deals, and generating leads.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and implement strategies to attract new clients and increase revenue
* Provide financial planning and investment management services to clients with a focus on creating unique portfolios made up of stocks and bonds
* Build and maintain strong client relationships
* Analyze financial information and provide recommendations
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and regulations
* Collaborate with team members to deliver exceptional client service


**Requirements:**  

* Series 7 License
* Proven experience as a Financial Advisor with a focus on bringing in new clients and closing deals
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to analyze financial information and provide recommendations
* Knowledge of stocks and bonds.


**Benefits:**  

* Competitive Base Salary
* Work exclusively with High Net Worth individuals.
* Relocate to Naples, Florida.
* Lucrative commissionable earnings. Be part of a boutique firm where the current advisors earn between $400k and $800k in commission per annum.
